name: DORA
governingBody: European Parliament and Council of the European Union
description: DORA harmonizes ICT risk management rules across the EU financial sector, ensuring all participants can withstand, respond to, and recover from ICT-related disruptions and threats. It explicitly covers third-party ICT providers and mandates resilience testing including TLPT. DORA fills a critical gap by moving beyond traditional financial risk to address operational technology risk.

certificationDetails.assessor: National competent authorities (NCAs) and European Supervisory Authorities (ESAs)

lifecycle.name: ICT Risk Assessment
lifecycle.description: Identify, classify, and document all ICT-supported business functions and assess ICT risk for each.

lifecycle.name: Framework Implementation
lifecycle.description: Implement ICT risk management framework, incident management procedures, and resilience testing program.

lifecycle.name: Third-Party Management
lifecycle.description: Assess and manage ICT third-party risks. Establish contractual arrangements. Create register of ICT providers.

lifecycle.name: Ongoing Operations
lifecycle.description: Conduct regular resilience testing, manage incidents, report to authorities, and continuously improve.

domains.name: ICT Risk Management (Articles 5-16)
domains.description: Comprehensive framework for identifying, protecting against, detecting, responding to, and recovering from ICT risks.

controls.name: ICT Risk Management Framework
controls.description: Establish and maintain a sound, comprehensive, and well-documented ICT risk management framework as part of the overall risk management system.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document comprehensive ICT risk management framework. Assign management body responsibility. Review and update annually. Define risk appetite.

controls.name: ICT Systems Identification
controls.description: Identify, classify, and adequately document all ICT-supported business functions, information assets, and ICT assets.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain comprehensive ICT asset inventory. Classify systems by criticality. Document interdependencies. Map ICT assets to business functions.

controls.name: ICT Protection and Prevention
controls.description: Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy strong access controls, encryption, patch management, and network security. Implement change management procedures.

controls.name: ICT Detection
controls.description: Establish mechanisms to promptly detect anomalous activities, including ICT network performance issues and ICT-related incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy SIEM and monitoring tools. Implement anomaly detection. Define detection thresholds. Enable real-time alerting.

controls.name: ICT Response and Recovery
controls.description: Put in place a comprehensive ICT business continuity policy with response and recovery strategies.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop ICT business continuity and disaster recovery plans. Define RTO/RPO. Implement backup and restoration procedures. Test annually.

controls.name: Backup Policies and Procedures
controls.description: Implement backup policies and restoration procedures ensuring data can be restored with minimum downtime.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement automated backups. Store offsite/multi-region. Test restoration regularly. Encrypt backups.

controls.name: Learning and Evolving
controls.description: Gather knowledge from ICT incidents and share lessons learned to improve the risk management framework.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct post-incident reviews. Document lessons learned. Update risk management framework based on findings. Share intelligence.

controls.name: Communication
controls.description: Implement communication plans for responsible disclosure of ICT incidents and vulnerabilities.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define internal and external communication procedures. Establish crisis communication templates. Train spokespersons.

domains.name: ICT-Related Incident Management (Articles 17-23)
domains.description: Processes for detecting, managing, classifying, and reporting ICT-related incidents.

controls.name: ICT Incident Management Process
controls.description: Establish and implement an ICT-related incident management process to detect, manage, and notify ICT-related incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement incident management framework. Define severity levels. Establish escalation procedures. Automate incident ticketing.

controls.name: Classification of ICT Incidents
controls.description: Classify ICT incidents based on defined criteria including impact, duration, geographic spread, and criticality of affected services.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define classification criteria. Implement automated classification. Tag incidents by severity, impact, and affected systems.

controls.name: Major Incident Reporting
controls.description: Report major ICT-related incidents to the relevant competent authority. Initial notification within 4 hours of classification.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish reporting workflows. Prepare template reports. Define 4-hour initial notification, 72-hour intermediate, 1-month final report timelines.

controls.name: Voluntary Notification of Significant Cyber Threats
controls.description: Financial entities may voluntarily notify competent authorities of significant cyber threats they deem relevant.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish voluntary reporting procedures. Participate in information-sharing arrangements. Define thresholds for voluntary reporting.

domains.name: Digital Operational Resilience Testing (Articles 24-27)
domains.description: Testing digital operational resilience of ICT systems to identify weaknesses.

controls.name: General Resilience Testing Requirements
controls.description: Establish, maintain, and review a digital operational resilience testing programme.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop resilience testing program. Include vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, scenario-based testing. Test at least annually.

controls.name: Testing of ICT Tools and Systems
controls.description: Perform testing including vulnerability assessments, open source analyses, network security assessments, source code reviews.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct vulnerability scans quarterly. Perform source code reviews. Analyze dependencies. Test network security.

controls.name: Threat-Led Penetration Testing (TLPT)
controls.description: Significant financial entities shall carry out advanced Threat-Led Penetration Testing at least every 3 years.
controls.implementationGuidance: Engage qualified TLPT providers. Follow TIBER-EU framework. Test critical business functions. Include third-party providers in scope.

domains.name: ICT Third-Party Risk Management (Articles 28-44)
domains.description: Managing risk from ICT third-party service providers.

controls.name: General Principles for ICT Third-Party Risk
controls.description: Manage ICT third-party risk as an integral part of ICT risk. Maintain a register of all ICT third-party arrangements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain ICT third-party register. Conduct pre-contract risk assessments. Define concentration risk policies. Report register to regulators.

controls.name: Key Contractual Provisions
controls.description: Contractual arrangements for ICT services shall include specific provisions covering SLAs, data location, audit rights, and exit strategies.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include required DORA clauses in contracts. Define SLAs. Specify data locations. Ensure audit rights. Create exit strategies.

controls.name: Concentration Risk Assessment
controls.description: Assess and manage concentration risk arising from dependence on specific ICT third-party providers.
controls.implementationGuidance: Map critical function dependencies. Identify concentration risks. Develop alternative or contingency plans for critical providers.

controls.name: Oversight of Critical ICT Providers
controls.description: Critical ICT third-party providers are subject to direct oversight by the Lead Overseer designated by the ESAs.
controls.implementationGuidance: Identify if providers are designated as critical. Ensure providers cooperate with Lead Overseer. Include oversight provisions in contracts.

domains.name: Information Sharing (Article 45)
domains.description: Arrangements for exchanging cyber threat information and intelligence.

controls.name: Information Sharing Arrangements
controls.description: Financial entities may exchange cyber threat information and intelligence, including indicators of compromise.
controls.implementationGuidance: Participate in financial sector ISACs. Share IOCs with trusted communities. Consume threat intelligence feeds.

breachNotification.timeframe: 4 hours initial notification after classification as major; 72 hours intermediate; 1 month final
breachNotification.threshold: Major ICT-related incidents as defined by classification criteria
